abstract.para: Code examples that show how to use &Rustlong; with &AWS;.

section.para: The code examples in this topic show you how to use the &Rustlong; with &AWS;.

variablelist.para: The examples are divided into the following categories:

listitem.para: Code excerpts that show you how to call individual service functions.
Code examples that show you how to accomplish a specific task by calling multiple functions within the same service.
Sample applications that work across multiple &AWS; services.

section.para: Examples

abstract.para: The following code examples show how to implement common scenarios and perform individual service actions by using &Rust; with &AWS; services.

section.para: The following code examples show how to perform actions and implement common scenarios by using the &Rustlong; with &AWS; services.
Actions are code excerpts that show you how to call individual service functions.
Scenarios are code examples that show you how to accomplish a specific task by calling multiple functions within the same service.
Services

abstract.para: Code examples that show how to use &Rustlong; with &ABP;.

section.para: The following code examples show you how to perform actions and implement common scenarios by using the &Rustlong; with &ABP;.
Actions are code excerpts that show you how to call individual &ABP; functions.
Scenarios are code examples that show you how to accomplish a specific task by calling multiple &ABP; functions.
Each example includes a link to GitHub, where you can find instructions on how to set up and run the code in context.
The following code example shows how to list &ABP; REST APIs.

The following code example shows how to create an &kms-key-long;.
The following code example shows how to create a random byte string that is cryptographically secure using &KMS;.
The following code example shows how to decrypt ciphertext that was encrypted by a &kms-key;.
The following code example shows how to encrypt text using a &kms-key;.

info.title: Generate a plaintext data key for client-side encryption
info.titleabbrev: Generate a plaintext data key for client-side encryption

section.para: The following code example shows how to generate a unique symmetric data key for client-side encryption from an &kms-key-long;. The key contains both plaintext and ciphertext versions.
The following code example shows how to generate an encrypted data key from an &kms-key-long;. The key contains only a ciphertext version.
The following code example shows how to list &kms-keys;.

info.title: Recencrypt ciphertext from one key to another
info.titleabbrev: Recencrypt ciphertext from one key to another

section.para: The following code example shows how to reencrypt ciphertext from one &kms-key; to another.
